text: Zooey Claire Deschanel ( ; born January 17, 1980) is an American actress, musician, and singer-songwriter. ==Early life== Zooey Deschanel was born in Los Angeles in 1980. She is the younger daughter of Academy Award–nominated cinematographer and director Caleb Deschanel and actress Mary Jo Deschanel (née Weir). Her paternal grandfather was French, from Oullins, Rhône. Her ancestry also includes Swiss, Dutch, English, Irish, and other French roots. ==Acting career== She starred in movie (500) Days of Summer and plays the central character in TV series New Girl. She also produces the show. ==Singing career== She and M. Ward are music duo She & Him. They have released five studio albums since 2008. She has collaborated with artists such as Prince and Brian Wilson. She wrote the main theme for New Girl and Winnie the Pooh: The Movie. ==Personal life== She married musician Ben Gibbard on September 19, 2009. The couple are separated; she filed for divorce on December 27, 2011. It was finalized on December 12, 2012. She married producer Jacob Pechenik in 2015. They have a daughter born in July, 2015. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Actors from Los Angeles Category:American movie actors Category:Singer-songwriters from California Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:Musicians from Los Angeles Category:Singers from Los Angeles Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:American game show hosts Category:20th-century American singers Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters Category:20th-century American actors Category:21st-century American actors Category:American pop singers
title: Zooey Deschanel
